title_full:
The Threshold HouseBoys Choir

              —
              Form Grows Rampant
            
              (Musique Pour La Danse)
label: Musique Pour La Danse
description:
Simply one of the strangest, greatest pieces of music we know, Sleazy Peter Christopherson’s 2007 turn as Threshold House Boys Choir becomes the next Coil-related project to see a welcome posthumous reissue.

Originally a CD + DVD release presenting the work in its original A/V form, replete with utterly compelling video of young Buddhist monks in... more

title_full:
VOICE ACTOR

              —
              Sent From My Telephone
            
              (STROOM)
label: STROOM
description:
This one's a lot but bear with us! Four-and-a-half-hours of sketchbook style cut-and-paste creations that sit at the intersection of Broadcast, Lolina, Fonal, Mark Leckey, Dean Blunt, Félicia Atkinson and Mica Levi. Stroom has properly outdone itself with this one - huge recommendation, with an emphasis on huge.

When we got sent this we were a... more

title_full:
Slauson Malone

              —
              for Star (Crater Speak)
            
              (Grand Closing)
label: Crater Speak
description:
Breakthru avant-soul expressionist Slauson Malone plays out two instrumental loose sketches in wickedly elusive style on his label, Grand Closing

Esteemed for his production on Danny Brown’s ‘uknowhatimsayin¿’ and emergent body of solo work, LA’s Saluson Malone grants access to stranger nooks of his swede with two amorphous, off-kilter sketches for bass... more

label: Anonymous Club
description:
Hood By Air co-founder Shayne Oliver leans into the LEECH moniker for six tracks of chaotic post-GHE20G0TH1K roboticka that's somewhere between Zebra Katz, Arca and Rabit. 

Released on his own Anonymous Club imprint "Headless" is a bold statement from Oliver, who follows last year's impressive "PROLOGUE" with another short, sharp collection of... more

title_full:
Paul Chain

              —
               Is Dead (Volume One)
            
              (Horn Of Plenty)
label: Volume One
description:
93 minute collection of the electronic, ambient, prog, and kosmische side of the 80's-90's Paul Chain catalogue.

Paul Chain is widely revered in the Doom Metal underground, and rightly so, but this collection aims to highlight the many 'other' sides to his work. Anyone interested in NWW list or Mutant Sounds should investigate. Officially licensed collection bringing... more

release: Club Romantico Presents - The Godfather of Raptor House
title_full:
DJ Baba

              —
              Club Romantico Presents - The Godfather of Raptor House
            
              (Club Romantico)
label: Club Romantico
description: Thrilling Venezuelan hard dance pressure from Pedro Elias Corro, AKA DJ Baba, inventor of “Raptor House” -  widely recognised as the first purely Venezuelan electronic music genre, here served steaming hot via DJ Florentino’s Club Romantico. An unmissable workout for hips and party bodies on the line from Arca to De Schuurman, Nick León to... more

label: AD 93
description:
Coby Sey fully transcends everything we expected - and that was already a lot - on his shapeshifting debut album; a multi-layered fractalisation of Tricky-level trip-hop, blitzed electronics, post Grime, surrealist poetry and filthy basement techno. We're ruined by this one - one of the most gripping and satisfying braindumps we've heard this year.

Trip-hop's been... more

title_full:
Duval Timothy

              —
              Meeting With A Judas Tree
            
              (Carrying Colour)
label: Carrying Colour
description:
Duval Timothy’s piano music grows in stature and sprawling ideas with this mix of odes to Mahler and electro-acoustic/concrète evocations of the landscapes to England, Italy, and West Africa, featuring guest input by Fauzia, Yu Su, Vegyn and Lamin Fofana

‘Meeting With a Judas Tree’ is Timothy’s first solo album since 2020 and a significant way... more

label: Tra Tra Trax
description:
Don of the moment, Nick León fuses raptor house’s Eurohouse influence on a pair of zingers b/w strong remixes by Pearson Sound and Doctor Jeep

Arriving in the wake of his high grade EPs with Florentino’s Club Romántico, Naafi, and Future Times,  León jumps back to Colombia’s Tra Tra Trax with two proper heaters for ’22. In ‘Xtasis’ we hear him emphasise the... more

label: RVNG Intl.
description: Berlin-based Colombian noisemaker Lucrecia Dalt ties off a blistering run of releases with her latest album proper, the follow-up to 2020's acclaimed "No Era Solida". Using Latin American rhythms like bolero, sasa and merengue, and singing in Spanish for the first time in almost a decade, Dalt brings contemporary speculative intrigue to elements all too often... more

label: Portraits GRM
description: Contemporary drone visionary Kali Malone gathers a new, electroacoustic ensemble for her monumental first entry to the GRM pantheon, factoring her pursuit of dynamic timbral horizons with a subtly re-calibrated sense of scale and heightened emotive levity that straddles early music, 20th century American minimalism, electronic drone and widescreen... more

title_full:
Florentino & BAMBII & KD One

              —
              Constrictor
            
              (XL Recordings)
label: XL Recordings
description:
New levels from Manchester’s dembow pusherman Florentino, underlining Bambii & KD One with a deadly dancehall-reggaeton sidewinder on his first mission for XL

First introduced by Swing Ting, then pulling up on Mixpak, before building his Club Romántico label with aces by his Sangre Nueva trio with DJ Python & Kelman Duran, plus DJ Baba, and... more

title_full:
DJ Travella

              —
              Mr Mixondo
            
              (Nyege Nyege Tapes)
label: Nyege Nyege Tapes
description:
Holy fùck! Dar Es Salaam’s 19 y.o. DJ Travella pins the singeli flag at the pinnacle of Afrofuturist road and club music for 2022 with an incendiary introduction via Kampala’s Nyege Nyege Tapes.

Marking five years since NNT revolutionised international perceptions of East African music with the ’Sounds of Sisso’ comp, Hamadi Hassani aka DJ Travella naturally pushes... more

label: UNO NYC
description:
The eagerly-awaited sequel to Malibu's "One Life", "Palaces of Pity" is a euphoric ambient (trance?) elegy to calm, sublimating delayed guitars and cello into balearic zoomer-bient bliss sequences that remind us of Orbital, Burial, Enya.

'One Life' was an all-too-brief album that summarized a spectrum of moods, refining the slow crawl of nostalgic ambience... more

title_full:
Infinity Knives & Brian Ennals

            —
            King Cobra

label: Drag City
description:
Uniquely disciplined guitarist Oren Ambarchi hustles an all-star ensemble in filigree arrangements of joyous, hyper-rhythmic melodicism nodding to Albert Marcoeur, early Pat Metheny Group, Henry Kaiser’s It’s A Wonderful Life and Steve Reich’s Electric Counterpoint.

Following in the vein of his intricately detailed longform workouts including ‘Quixotism’ (2014)... more

label: Hakuna Kulala
description:
Another astonishing debut from Uganda's Hakuna Kulala imprint, 'Raw Space' introduces sonic hypnotist Authentically Plastic, who breaks open East African polyrhythms while nodding to nu-surrealist moves from Dean Blunt, Speaker Music, Nazar and Hieroglyphic Being. 

The Ugandan activist, DJ and producer has been making waves back home for the last... more

release: 唱着那无人问津的歌谣 / Chang Zhe Na Wu Ren Wen Jin De Ge Yao
title_full:
Organ Tapes

              —
              唱着那无人问津的歌谣 / Chang Zhe Na Wu Ren Wen Jin De Ge Yao
            
              (Worldwide Unlimited)
label: Worldwide Unlimited
description:
Tim Zha aka Organ Tapes makes a hyperjump to DJ Python's Worldwide Unlimited label with an emotionally slushed set of singer-songwriter pearls spiked with his own idiosyncratic production moves. An investigation into avant pop, it sounds like a DIY inversion filtered thru the autotuned hypersonix of Ecco2K, Yves Tumor or Palmistry.

For over a decade now... more

label: International Anthem
description:
Isotope 217/Chicago Underground Trio founder member Jeff Parker's new album features a handful of original compositions, a cover of Thelonious Monk's 'Ugly Beauty' and a new version of 'La Jetée', a track he performed with both Tortoise and Isotope 217. Gorgeous solo guitar music that's deceptively simple and effortlessly soulful.

On "Forfolks", Parker... more

DEATHPROD

              —
              Sow Your Gold In The White Foliated Earth
            
              (Smalltown Supersound)
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Staggering, career-defining work from Norwegian vanguard Helge Sten (aka Deathprod), who drives relentlessly forward on this illuminating new tome, using Harry Partch's extremely rare metal and glass instruments to pen a major new work that’s been years in the making and somehow resets modern experimental mores. Truly one of the most exceptional, most... more

title_full:
Tia Blake & her folk group

            —
            Folksongs & Ballads

Rainy Miller

              —
              Desquamation (Fire, Burn. Nobody)
            
              (HEAD II)
label: Fire, Burn. Nobody
description: Ambitious, complex and hooky breakthru opus by NW english rapper/producer/songwriter Rainy Miller, issued by The White Hotel’s Head II label and featuring contributions from Space Afrika, Blackhaine, Maxwell Sterling, Jam City, Georgia Ellery, Henzo and more. Highly emotive and bruised gear, it’s essential listening if yr into Future, Chief Keef, Drake, more... more

title_full:
Oli XL

              —
              Go Oli Go! / Cartoon Smile
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Warp Records
description:
Oli XL's glittering Warp debut doesn't disappoint - it's just as fractal and bizarre as 2019's exceptional "Rogue Intruder, Soul Enhancer", welding cyberplastique bass womps to contorted vox and alien nursery rhymes. Tip!

Oli's got a new anthem in 'Go Oli Go!' - revolving around a deadpan vocal (additional coos by Emilie Palmelund), it lurches from glitchy hyper-step... more

title_full:
Kendrick Lamar

            —
            Mr. Morale & The Big Steppers

label: NAAFI
description:
Embracing their cultural heritage and augmenting warped club sounds with Indonesian music theory and Southeast Asian tribal music, Animistic Beliefs make a profound statement with their N.A.A.F.I. debut. One for fans of Gabber Modus Operandi, Osheyack, M.E.S.H. or Raja Kirik.

While their previous work probed the dynamics of western club music... more

release: Don't Follow Me Because I'm Lost Too!!
title_full:
Vegyn

              —
              Don't Follow Me Because I'm Lost Too!!
            
              (PLZ Make It Ruins)
label: PLZ Make It Ruins
description:
Collaborator with everyone from Dean Blunt to JPEGMAFIA, Frank Ocean and Travis Scott; Vegyn drops an overlarge, 75-track, 2hr 33min mind-dump of material for London’s cult label PLZ Make It Ruins.

Clearing his cache of instrumental sketches at the head of a new year, Vegyn showcases his talent for woozy beatdown rap, R&B and club production in... more

label: O___o?
description:
Astonishing smouldering R&B flex from Brooklyn’s Dawuna, making strong debut moves on the ace O___o? label that gave us LA Timpa’s first record. If u like it slow x dripping in a prince/d'angelo style with intricate. almost concrète production - this is as good as it gets. The debut of the decade? Aye, we reckon v possibly.

Slow baked for a gooey core and crispy... more
